result.execSummary:
The defendant Fernando L Poblete was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Fernando L Poblete is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Fernando L Poblete was found guilty of Theft-Movable Property from Person [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.
*  Pay supervision fees.
Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.
*  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*  DE is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.
Cooperate with the Child Support Agency to establish paternity and/or to pay child support and make all court appearances in any paternity action.  May not associate with gangs/gang members or gang affiliations.  May not have contact with Erna Schneider, Miguel Poblete, Jovanni Mora, or persons who use or traffic in the sale of controlled substances, unless otherwise permitted by the court/agent.
*  Pay $500.00 extradition costs.

records.addlTxt:
Attorney Thomas Binger appeared for the State.  Def. appeared (in custody) with Atty Angela Komp.  Clerk K. Zirbel.  Count 1 -
Total length of sentence:  8 years WSP.
Initial term of confinenemt:  3 years WSP, credit for 139 days served.
Term of extended supervision:  5 years w/conditions.
Def. is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Substance Abuse Program.  
Pay extradition costs of $500.00 during term of extended supervision.  Defendant is ordered to submit a DNA sample; written notice provided to defendant.

Attorney Thomas Binger appeared for the State.  Def. appeared (in custody) with Atty Angela Komp.  Clerk K. Zirbel.  Amended Information filed.  Count 2 - Dismissed on State motion.  Count 1 (PTAC Felony Theft) - Plea of guilty; found guilty by the Court.  Presentence investigation ordered.  Sentencing 2/16/16 at 9:30.  Bond continued.

Defendant Fernando L Poblete appeared with Attorney Angela Komp.  Defendant in custody. Attorney Thomas Binger appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk JThwing. Minutes:  Atty Komp requests witnesses be sequestered.  Witnesses sequestered.  ST called witness KPD Josh Zeller ; sworn in and testified; cross-examination by Atty Komp. ST rested and moved for bind over; arguments heard. Probable cause found; bound over for trial Br 8. Information filed; reading waived. Not guilty pleas entered. Bond modified to $10,000 cash with the same conditions  Final pre-trial scheduled for November 10, 2015 at 09:20 am.
